The public transport system is overburdened today. The number of people accessing public transport far outweighs the number of people the transport system was designed to handle. The trains and buses are crowded, and newer routes and not reflecting the changing demand. Mass production has made cars more affordable to the middle class in recent years. Also, the increase in disposable income has given more buying power to consumers. Both these factors have led to increased purchase of cars over the last few years. This trend is likely to continue in the near future. Public transport cannot rival the sheer mobility that cars offer to their owners. Cars have the ability to take you from your home to your place of work, without any stopovers. If you have to take a train, you have to reach the train station by walking, taking a taxi or taking a bus. Further, after you board off the train, you again have to find your way to your destination by either walking or using another mode of transport. Cars make it easier to transport children and luggage. They are safer and cleaner. Cars are here to stay. The same, however, cannot be said about public transport.</s>

That provides, especially to one of the two detectives who are investigating about the crimes, a trace to follow in their investigation. In the movies are some references to the Dante's "Divina Commedia" Italian poem as well as to the Bible. The film is excellent because of both a very exciting and engaging plot, and great interpretation of the main characters - the serial killer and the two detectives.</s>

Thanks for sharing! I really enjoyed reading your blog about shadowing students. I like the way you gave examples how you felt and how you would change your own lessons. I live in the Netherlands and at our school it’s the same. Our pupils have to sit for many hours a day, and they find it hard to sit still and to be silent. I also think that a lesson went well if they didn’t talk and did their work. However, when I was reading your article I felt ashamed due to the fact that when every teacher teaches the way I do it is logical that our students can’t be quiet and can’t sit without making a move. Moreover, when we as teachers have a study day, I get tired myself by sitting all day. Your key takeaway #3 was shocking for me, the feeling of being a nuisance is dreadful. In my opinion I am very patient and willing to explain difficult topics over and over again. I really hope my students feel the same, otherwise I have to change my attitude! I get paid for being a teacher and, as I see it, it is my job to clarify and help my pupils to understand. Your experience gave me food for thought especially when you wrote that our pupils are sitting passively and listening during approximately 90 per cent of their classes. I am going to look at my lessons again to see if I can change those lessons and try to make my pupils active. I teach at Basisberoeps level and I have already started to use some activities were they must use an Ipad and make pictures or short films. For example, my pupils had to learn the difference between this and that and I let them make a short film about pointing at things in school saying: this door, that window, this is my teacher, that is a chair. However, I find it difficult to use activities every lesson because they are time consuming. Although the main reason that prevents me from using them are my colleagues. I don’t see them doing activities, it looks as if they are just doing their lessons and want to use a book and that is it. For instance, when I hear that another English teacher finished Unit 5 and I am still at Unit 4 I feel incompetently. It gives me the feeling that most important of teaching is doing all the exercises in the book and getting all the work done. Maybe you understand this</s>

I do agree television advertising direct toward young children should not bet allowed for several reasons. First, this kind of advertisement should be forbiden reasoning the fact young children are still strongly vulnerable. Kids around these age (2 to 5 years old) do not have a maturated critical sense and anything can easyly persuade them. For instance, when I was three years old I used to be captivated for all the toys which were presented on tv commercials just because the way they were exposed. One of them was "the ultimate max steel" which was about a hundred dollars. Secondly, I am also opposed the allowance of this advertisement because the severely consequence it causes into the parents and child's relationships. It is common we see parents having issues with their kids in reason to this kind of commercial. Many parents have an unhealthy relationship, or even a wrecked relationship, with their kids. One example is what happened with/to my cousin Patricia when she had her first child called Sophia. One day sophia got really excited with an advertisement about barbie doll and she could not think about anything else than having this toy. Unfortunately, my cousin did not have enough money to buy it, but her daughter - a three years old kid- did not understand it and got angry with Patricia, do not speaking well with her for three weeks! In conclusion, I am strongly favourable to this statement. Advertisement for young kids, not only until 5 but until 8 years old should be forbiden reasoning the kid's vulnerability and the risk to their parents' relationships with them. In last case, if the advertisements were still exposed, It would be essential some educational politics come with them, valorizing and teaching kids on understanding their parents.</s>

Before focusing on the topic of technology itself, I would like to mention some aspects related to education. First of all, Spanish educational laws are in Europe, and probably in the world, the only ones which have changed the most in the last 30 years. This fact leads the teachers to be unsure of what they are doing. Besides, there are no results that can be analysed or checked. Secondly, there are two sorts of schools in Spain-public and private-, which produces a big difference in the educational knowledge. While public ones must obey governmental laws strictly, private schools have some privileges. Knowing this about the Spanish education system, we can now talk about technology. I obviously agree that nowadays technology is necessary. So, the schools and the educational institutions in general have to update the way they teach. Technology does not imply a new instrument to be taught but a new tool and source of knowledge (if used correctly). In fact, using technology without changing the contents would be a total failure. Teachers must learn how to use these new technological devices in order to get their students motivated. Moreover, they should comprise the past information and the new one. Thus, this would help students know how the world has evolved and how it will be. In other words, technology should be used as a tool for the students be aware of the development of society and its advantages and disadvantages. This new technologies also help in the teaching development. We can make dynamic classes by being in contact with other schools, in the case of subjects such as English and French, students would improve their skills by being in contact with students from different countries. Also, teachers could replace their methodologies following the best ones and the ones which contribute to have qualified students trained to face everyday life situations. In conclusion, as a great teacher said, we have 21st century students learning with 20th century tools the 19th century knowledge. Thus, there must not be a technological revolution but an educational one. </s>

Michael sat in the bus and take out his dairy to calculate how much he have to invest in the tennis court. A girl came and sat in the seat next to him. She asked him when the bus is going to depart but Michael replied that he was also not aware of the departure time. The bus starts after half an hour and Michael start talking with his parents over the phone and discussed his business.The strange girl who was sitting next to him was listening to music and looking outside trying to ignore the details that Michael was sharing with his parents.It was a 13 hour journey and the girl wanted to talk with Michael and so she offered chips but he denied. After some time the bus stopped for 5 min and Michael bought two chocolates, chips and a soft drink and offered her a chocolate. The girl accepted the chocolate with a smile and asked him where he was going? This is how they start their conversation and while exchanging conversation, they felt as if they know each other for a long time... they got attracted towards each other and in the midst of that they kissed each other and even exchanged phone numbers. Their bus was about to reach their destination next morning so Michael offered her to drop at home and the girl agreed with a smile. At that time they felt not like parting but they have to and Michael dropped her home and returned back to his own home. After returning home, Michael flash backed what he did in the bus. Anna knew that it was going to be a very special day for her. She woke up and at once she felt something makes her happy. She went to the kitchen and saw a beautifully prepared breakfast. She wondered who could make such a pleasant surprise. Suddenly, she remembered that for three days she living with Chuck - her boyfriend. She ate breakfast, dressed up and go to work. The day was very sunny and cloudless. It was the first day of Spring and everything is going rise to life. Flowers was in every colour of rainbow, the leaves on the trees going green. When she came to office, she saw on her desk a note with a heart shape. Anna opened it and read: "Probably this day will be the best day of your life". She smiled and thought that is a joke. But moment later she found a second letter about the same shape. She opened again and again read: " Meet me at 11 at the fountain in the park". Anna looked at her watch and as fast as she can run to the park. It appers that at the fountain stay Chuck and waiting for her. When she come closer he knelt on one knee and said: "Will you marry me Anne?". She was shocked. She was run out of words and just nod her head what it means: "yes". They together come back home and spend rest of the day together. At the end of the day she said: "You're right. It's the best day of my life".</s>

My hometown, Piliyandala, is probably the smallest town in Colombo district provides shelter for more than 100,000 people. The town has approximately 15 villages and all of them are governed by the urban council. The Garbage control service is one of the main supporting subsidiaries of the urban council which was founded two years ago. Five years ago, the town didn't have any garbage control services to manage the domestic rubbish. With this garbage control system, household waste being collected on weekly basis and transported to recycling centers. The recycling centers sort these garbage and are put into different categories to be recycled, categorized garbage are then transported to the recycling process in the nearest factory. Two years ago, the council started a wastebasket distributing program among the villages with the intention of easing the garbage collection process.With this approach, it is very convenient for the workers who are engaged in the garbage control service because they can collect all the garbage of a village in one place. Meanwhile, the urban council highly discourage the use of plastic products and other artificial materials for the sake of our own cleanliness. Villages on the other hand, doing their best to reduce the load of domestic waste. </s>

There is no doubt that travelling by car is the most comfortable option, but claiming that public transport has no future is too much. Many people use public transport on a daily basis. There are people who wouldn't be able to travel if it wasn't for public transport. Children and elders can't have a driving license, so if they need to go somewhere, using public transport is their only option. Travelling by car is also very detrimental for the environment. In big cities, the air is very polluted because there are too many cars. Travelling by public transport lowers the impact on the environment, something that most people are aware of, but still they prefer to use their own vehicle. Using public transport can also save time, since you don't have to spend time looking for a place to park your car. I definitely think that public transport will continue to be very important in the future. </s>

I choose option A: I think it is a good idea for children to travel on public transit. There are several reasons why I support this choice. First, it is unnecessary to spend more money on school buses because by Grade 5 children are able to take care of themselves and each other. They can communicate well and are aware of dangerous situations. For example, if they see drunk or dirty people on public buses, they could avoid sitting near them or report them to the bus driver. Second, it is a good opportunity to educate them in life skills such as knowing not to sit in priority seats or leave litter on the bus. In contrast, I think that the parents who insist their children should only travel on school buses protect them too much. In daily life, many youngsters need to go to school and back by public transportation. In other words, if parents spoil their offspring then they may become too dependent and incapable of functioning well in society later on. In conclusion, it is not only a good chance to take the children on an adventure, but also help them become independent young adults. I think this way can assist them in adapting to society early.</s>

The Soviet Union collapse has become one of the defining events in the world’s history. It influenced the further development of post-Soviet countries as well geopolitical situation in the whole world. It has also influenced the international relations not just within post-Soviet area, but also in the entire world, as the period after the collapse of the USSR was marked as crash of bipolar structure of international relations. So long as for fifty years the world lived under the shadow of the Cold War, fearing a fatal confrontation between the US and the Soviet Union, the dissolution of the USSR had a huge resonance not only in the US mass-media but also in the American society. American press had widely illustrated the revolution in the Baltic States and the tension which has been spread in the Soviet Union after the fall of the Berlin Wall as well as the fall of communist governments within the whole former Soviet Bloc. The tensions in the Soviet Union came to its peak in August 1991, while Gorbachev was on vacation in the Crimea, a group of right wing military and KGB leaders staged a coup in Moscow. The”New York Times” made a series of publications dedicated to the coup. They were published under the common title “Soviet crisis”. The articles headlined “Soviet crisis” have broadly described the situation in the capital of Russia. On the August 20, “New York Times” published the article which contained the excerpts from the news conference held by Acting President Gennadiy Yanayev and four other members of the State Committee for the State of Emergency. The American press summing up the era of Gorbachov frequently highlighted his attempts to increase the openness of the Soviet society. Those attempts were considered as one of Gorbachov’s main merits. “The buried secrets of past regimes and the foibles of the present one were exposed to public scrutiny by a press ” – the New York Times wrote. The plotters have immediately encountered strong opposition from the leadership of the RSFSR leaders under the guidance of President Boris Yeltsin. Tens of thousands hit the streets in Russia in order to defend the democracy. Decisive actions of Yeltsin have been supported by most world governments and international communities. Boris Yeltsin has gained international acclaim when </s>

Many people believe that public transport will be replaced by private one in the nearest future. The main reason is the convenience of travelling by cars in comparison with using public transport. Apart from that, there are many other benefits in buying a car instead of using buses or underground every day. First of all, an automobile gives such a valuable thing as privacy. For example, driving a car we can wear whatever we want and listen to the music on any volume. If the car is large enough, it can be even a perfect place for sleep. Additionally, if we are eager to travel outside the town in order to have some rest from a hectic rhythm of life, it will be more comfortable for us to use our cars. Only our own vehicle can provide us with an opportunity to find any quiet and pleasant place outside the city. Public transport can take us just to certain locations. Thus, it is clear that private transport such as automobiles has plenty of advantages. On the other hand, we can stuck with different problems while travelling by car. For instance, staying in traffic jams always steals much our precious time. Car accidents are the typical reason for this phenomenon. It means that travelling by cars can even be more dangerous than using public transport. Generally, bus drivers are much more experienced than automobile ones, therefore, accidents caused by public transport happen quite rarely. This makes travelling by public transport much safer. Thus, I would argue that driving a car requires much attention and understanding that careless behaviour on the road can make a serious damage to other people. In conclusion, I believe that public transport will eventually lose its dominance due to the fact that all people want to be independent and travel on their own. </s>

I would say that this is because the public transport are not so efficient as the should do. In my town for example, I have been Waiting for up to forty minutes before I could take a bus. I strongly believe that it is a shame because a lot of people like me would live their vehicles at home and take a train instead. Secondly, the environment would improve its state indeed, as far as I can see the pollution caused by the traffic is ruining monuments and making the air dirty and heavy, the same is as far as waste of time is concerned, obviously the fewer cars are around the quicker you can get where you want. In conclusion I would really like that politicians who care about public transport will improve the services so that more people could leave their vehicles at home and move around much more easily.</s>

Sometimes we do things we don't want for no apparent reason but some other times we know exactly where we are getting into. Michael had cheated on her and he did it consciously. There was no way to shine a different light to that fact. He tried in his mind to go back to that moment, when his lips were getting closer to Jane, to that last look before the embrace, to the previous smile. There was no one else to blame but him. Regret had been filling up his soul since last Friday. He could not keep his betrayal inside any longer so he entered the living room and told her. The words coming up from his mouth like a litany, almost mechanically as he realized that there was no turning back. Tears ran down Rachel's face. No words, not a single comment. She just stood up, took her purse, and left. The relieve of telling her was instantly replaced by a bitter hollowness. He now realized. He didn't do it for her, he only did it for himself, to get rid of his burden but it was far too late. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.</s>

I think, one of the important historical places in Japan is the Kiyomizu temple in Kyoto. It is well-known with a great beautiful Buddhist temple in Japan and it's also famous among foreigner. Kiyomizu temple was built in the middle of Edo era. It has five stairs and one of the tallest historical building in Kyoto. People can see a great Japanese view from there. It is a great and famous sightseeing place and it also is an important place of Japanese culture. Kiyomizu temple was used many times as a background of a lot of Japanese novels, paints and historical dramas. Artists think the top of the temple is good for making beautiful, nervous mood of stories or paints. Also, the temple became a Japanese proverb which is "feel like falling from the top of Kiyomizu". It means "very scared and nervous" because the temple is very tall and it makes people such a feeling.</s>

Introduction The purpose of this report is to outline actions taken by the authorities of Mi<unk>sk Mazowiecki in the sphere of preserving the environment. What happens to the rubbish The local government of Mi<unk>sk Mazowiecki has recently implemented new laws which concern rubbish segregation. It is obligatory for the inhabitants to put their different types of garbage into separate bins. Although citizens usually obey those rules, in some cases they are completely neglected. However, people who have bigger houses tend to compost the organic waste and that makes up for the disobedient. The situation with household litter looks much better rather than what happens on the streets of the city. Waste is thrown on the ground and very few people are concerned about this problem. Town's actions As not all inhabitants are sensitive about the environment, it is the local government's responsibility to decrease the harmful effects of people's actions. Authorities make sure that rubbish bins are placed in small distances since this is the most common reason why people throw litter on the ground. How did this happen? How can I be here at D’el Arte wearing a suit and tie with my beautiful wife? The day hadn’t been planned to end with a date night. Then it all dawned on me. I’d been set up. Duped, so to say, into this unlikely event, a date night. Her plan was so clever and deceptive as to escape detection until the last card had been played. Oh, my wife is clever. When exactly did the deception begin? Was it the party which lasted until 3am the night before? Was it at the invitation to the wedding three weeks ago? How far back could it possibly go. When was this seed planted in my wife’s brain to have a date night with me all dressed up and formal? So many twists and turns-she played her cards well, I never suspected while sitting in the pews next to my wife that when she leaned forward with a pained expression on her face that the evening would end at D’el Arte. Nor when her condition appeared to worsen and I decided to go get the car to take her to the doctor’s office, nor when I returned to find her lying on the cold hard stone floor of the church could I have ever imagined we would be enjoying a quiet evening together sharing entrees and desserts. Nor could I have conceived after having multiple people help calling the ambulance, which never came, or the friends who called my in-laws to come take care of the kids, that we would be eating a wonderful pizza by the end of the evening. No, none of these things would have prepared me for the relief I would feel after waiting 4 hours in the emergency room that her pains were probably only intercostal muscle pains and the test for something more serious were all negative. Honestly dear, next time just ask me. I’ll say yes. </s>

Due to the ever-increasing population coupled with the climate change, food shortage has become a significant facing by many countries. Some assert that genetically modified technology can be applied to address this problem. This essay will argue that genetically modified food can be the way out of the problem of food deficit and this will be done by focusing on its environmental benefits and increasing food yield. Firstly, GM food can have a positive impact on the problem of food safety. It is well known that the GM food is inserted with various resistance genes, such as pest disease resistance gene. This means that the food being more resistant to pests and agricultural diseases can minimise the use of chemical pesticides and fertilizers that can poison the water supply and pollute the environment. This reduction in the application of chemical materials can create a safer agricultural environment, ensuring food safety. Furthermore, GM food can also improve the production of crops. Due to the various new traits resulting from the GM technology, such as drought tolerance and salinity tolerance, GM food can ensure the food production in the period of drought. This could be important for food production, especially in developing countries. However, some may argue that it is also questionable whether GM food has a detrimental impact on human health. Actually, thousands of tests on GM food, before bring it into markets, have been proven that it is harmless to both the environment and human health. In conclusion, it is evident that GM food can increase food yields with the less use of chemicals. In views of this, it is reasonable to believe that GM food might be an ideal strategy to alleviate the problem of food shortage. However, because there are some disadvantages in GM technology which is being developed, it is also recommended that governments should give more importance to the management of GM food.</s>

House at the End of the Street The last movie I watched was House Next Door, a captivating thriller that stars Jennifer Lawrence, Elizabeth Shue and Mark Thieriot. The plot is about a teenage girl who moves in with her mother to their dream house, which was next to a home where a horrible double homicide had taken place in. As soon as they move in, they hear the rumors of the incident: a little girl brutally murdered her parents in the middle of the night and disappeared, and the other child of the family recently moved in there. As the movie develops, it has lots of interesting turns that let the viewer form his/her own conclusions. I myself am a fan of horror movies, which are highly predictable, so it was a great satisfaction to see such a complex film. The end completely blew me away and I believe it was the best part of it. The acting was smooth and credible. Although it had bad critics, the movie was well received by the audience; not to mention Jennifer Lawrence's appearance right after the hit of Hunger Games was great for advertising. In conclusion, I highly recommend this film for those who like drama and plot twists. </s>

With no doubt all parents want their children to be citizen models. However raising a child into a model citizen is extremely hard - working. Some people think that this job should be done by the parents and others think unfairly that this is the teacher's responsibility. On one hand, parents should take responsibility on their children education as they are a child's first contact. Also, parents are like models to follow for their children, and as children do what they see they will copy their parents actions. Indeed school is the first place where a children interacts with society. However, they will talk or build a relationship based on what they see their parents doing with other people. Ultimately, teachers may have different values from the ones of the parents. On the other hand, parents may have lack of time to spend with their children due to demanding jobs and to provide everything that their children need, for example pay for their children school. It can also be argued that children spend most of their time at school and not at home, making the school responsibility to pass good social values. But it should not be forgotten, that parents have the most influence as they are models to follow. To sum up, parents should take full responsibility for their children education. However, one should take into account that a school with similar values to the ones of the parents would be a great help in the children raising process.</s>

Military service is the military training which requires people to join the army for a period of time. In Korean, people must do military service for at least 2 years. Similarly, people do it for 1 year in Taiwan. There is a debate about whether everyone should do military service when they reach 18 years old. The supporters maintain that it is important for national security and makes people more mature, whilst the opponents claim that military service affects study and should have freedom of choice. Firstly, every country needs military defense must be protected by a stronger armed forces for national security. If a war or other dangerous threat to the safety of the country, they cannot get help from other countries immediately. Therefore, people completing military service could protect their country more easily. In particular, a small population of a country has a policy that people need to do military service in order to develop into a powerful country. Secondly, being more mature when they complete military service is important, which probably is a particular experience for 18-year-olds. In addition to hard physical training and acquiring different special skills, people also improve their personal qualities as a result of doing military service. Consequently, people seem to be more                             and stronger than other people who do not complete military service. In contrast, the opponents of military service point out that studying is the first vital thing for people when they reach 18 years old. Military service mainly improves physical fitness, whereas study might be completed better in school at the age because it has a professional teaching staff and a good study environment, people usually concentrate easier on learning knowledge. For instance, some countries allow people to do military service after all their courses are finished. In addition, critics argue that countries should allow people more freedom of choice regarding military service. 
  
  some people are unwilling to do military service, people volunteer for military service potentially enjoy it. Furthermore, respect for the rights of people, especially for women who are unable to withstand the hard training, must also be ensured. In conclusion, it can be concluded that military service is necessary for national security and good for people improving themselves. The best solution would be for the government to try to allow people to volunteer for military service when they complete their studies. </s></s>

Set in late 1950s France, Chocolat deals with the topic of society discriminating against different people because of their being different: whether they are gypsies, women that don’t depend on men, or people that don’t share the Christian faith. The plot revolves around Vianne Rocher, a single mother and chocolate expert, opening a ‘chocolaterie’ right before Lent in a small, close-minded French village, the mayor of which decides to boycott her. During Lent, the protagonist gets to know other outcasts (mainly women) and helps them. However, Vianne must learn to solve her own problems and change the course of her own life. One of the strengths of the film is its star-studded cast: Juliette Binoche as Vianne, Alfred Molina as the mayor, Judi Dench as a grumpy old woman   
  with the oppressive society of the village, and young Johnny Depp as a tall, handsome gypsy arriving in town with his caravan. Each and every role is beautifully written and the actors don’t fail at bringing them to life. Besides the cast, I would like to highlight the original soundtrack. It harmonizes perfectly with the theme of the movie, with a little bit of jazz manouche, a popular genre amongst European gypsy communities, and references to Mexican folklore, as the recipes Vianne Rocher prepares in the ‘chocolaterie’ are a heritage from her Maya ancestors. If I had to find a down side to Chocolat, it would be that the film format does not allow us to get a deeper look into some of the characters and their storylines. Had it been written today, instead of in the year 2000, I am sure that this story would have been turned into a successful TV series in which we could have learnt more about the past and the future of those fantastic characters. All in all, this is a gripping, moving, and entertaining film that will make you reflect on some social issues. A must-see if, like me, you enjoy cinema with strong female characters in the leading roles, but you do not necessarily want to watch another dramatic story. </s></s>
Nowadays, students have a wide variety of forms of education. They may not only learn at school but also through the Internet. It has both advantages and disadvantages. The main advantage of learning on the Internet is time-saving. When we attend school, we often waste time on the buses going to and from school, which we might intend to use for studying. In the case of Internet learning, we can set our own hours for learning. Also, the possibility of learning at home is a big advantage, especially for people who prefer peace and quiet. Then it is better to concentrate on learning and we don't feel any pressure or stress connected with answering questions and taking tests. On the other hand, through long-term Internet learning we could feel bored or lonely. School provides an opportunity to learn in a group when students can help each other and solve problems. Another disadvantage of learning on the Internet can be an issue with the Internet connection. It does not always work correctly. </s></s>
The social debate between progress and tradition has been going on for centuries. Through our customs, we celebrate our past and keep our cultural heritage alive. But it is also because of this set of beliefs, mostly of religious origin, that some societies fail to evolve and respond to the ever-changing needs of all of their people. One of the main advantages of cultural practices is that they allow societies to maintain their identities and achieve economic stability. In most Latin American countries, millennial practices such as silversmithing not only keep the region in touch with its heritage, but they have become the sole source of income for many communities. Nations like Mexico and Peru, with internationally recognized cuisines, have taken advantage of their culinary roots and boosted the production of locally grown foods, like chipotle peppers and quinoa, to bring economic growth to their agricultural sectors. On the other hand, the greatest disadvantage of traditions, is that religious beliefs have kept these very same populations from social and human rights progress. Gay marriage and reproductive rights are not recognized by the government of Costa Rica and most Latin American governments because of the set of beliefs of a percentage of their community. In conclusion, traditions should be cherished and kept alive for future generations. However, the safekeeping of these practices should never become a priority over the well-being of the collective. Progress and tradition are not opposites in a society where respect and tolerance for others is the priority. </s></s>

It was a beautiful Sunday morning and Michael was preparing to go out to meet his old friend Peter. He was running to the cafe where they were supposed to meet. Peter was already there and he immediately told Michael about a trip to Italy that he had planned for them. Everything sounded great, they only needed a little bit more money and a car. Michael thought that he could use his father's car, and borrow some money from his mother. He knew that Peter was a little bit irresponsible, but he thought that the arrangement sounded perfect and nothing could go wrong. He managed to get the money and took the car from his dad and went to pick up Peter up. He went to Peter's apartment to help him with his luggage. He was thinking that this time things would be different, everything was planned and they would have a great time. He opened the door and saw that Peter wasn't packed at all, he had changed his mind about the trip. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.







It had been a very long and tiring day, but Tom felt he had achieved something really good. Tom was convinced this day would be better than the others. He was not fully recovered from the scare he had that day. He sat in his chair and looked out the window. "....." He looked down at his hands. He was shaking. He shook his head and looked up to the ceiling. He started working on his homework, but he had trouble concentrating as the memories came back to his mind. "I can't...do it" he slammed his head on the desk. "I can't" He looked at the bathroom door and walked to it. He turned on the lights to see his reflection in the mirror. The same face as ever. When he looked in the bathroom, he saw something on the floor. It was a note. "Tom. Tom. Tom. Tom" it said. That scared him. It couldn't be him again... He turned the note over to see something scrawled on it, "1992-2015". He felt it again. The same feeling he had when he saw it. He fell backwards and when he looked up, he saw it again. "Tom. You are rude. You are late for your death date" </s></s>

People often forget how important it is to help save the environment on a day-to-day basis, yet I believe it is not only the first step, but the most important to public awareness. Living in a big city, I cycle to work every day, which I believe is a great way to exercise and reduce my environmental footprint. Besides, cycling along a canal allows me to witness flowers and trees blooming and the chicks of birds growing up, reminding me of the beauty of nature. However, I believe that at home is where I contribute most to saving natural resources; we are, obviously, very careful about turning off the taps as we wash our hands, brush our teeth, and so on, and we recycle as much as possible. Yet, our most rewarding action has been starting a compost heap. We feed worms with our food and organic waste, which has drastically decreased it. Moreover, we now use the compost on our garden    
, and with the cacti. Another good point: we have converted our next door neighbour! Composting has made us more aware of our waste and the amount of packaging in the items we buy. I definitely recommend it to everyone, whether they live in a flat or in a house with a garden. </s></s>

According to Berkow (2004), airway management is one component of the anaesthesia procedure to ensure the patient's airway is opened. An example of an intervention in airway management is the face mask that Mr. Sharma was using. Also, this practice is the primary consideration for efficient post-operative care (Scoot, 2012). The majority of patients that have had general anaesthesia, like Mr. Sharma, must recover in a PACU (Post Anaesthesia Care Unit) to monitor the vital signs, especially airway management due to the anaesthesia, which can lead to postoperative complications (Scoot, 2012; Farrell & Dempsey, 2011). Over the first 24 hours after surgery, the period is considered the most critical period because the patient can present primarily with lung disorders, and the nurse needs to maintain cardio-respiratory stability (Popov & Peniche, 2009). Addressing the airway management after Mr. Sharma came to the PACU, the first procedure that the nurse should do is follow the A-G assessment protocol to review the stability and the airway patency of the patient, sustaining pulmonary ventilation to prevent hypoxemia and hypercapnia (Farrell & Dempsey, 2010). Mr. Sharma's airway should be clear and free of mucus or blood (Pudner, 2010). Due to the surgery, Mr Sharma is in a supine position, but this position reduces his oxygenation (Snowball, 2012), and can also impede airflow related to the anaesthetic effect, where the tongue and lower jaw fall backward. Hence, he needs oxygen supply to prevent any airway obstruction. Therefore, oxygen therapy needs to continue immediately along with his admission, via nasal cannula or oxygen mask at 4 to 6L/min, until the anaesthetic effects are completely gone and the patient's oxygen saturation is restored (Farrell & Dempsey, 2010). Thus, Mr. Sharma was given O2 via Hudson mask 6L/min because he received general anaesthesia and all of his muscles were relaxed, at the moment, he did not have control over his reflexes (Farrell & Dempsey, 2010). To help

I'm 24 years old, so I belong to the previous generation when family, school and life in general worked in a different way from my point of view. I have a wonderful family made up of my father, my mother and my two siblings (a sister and a brother), both older than me. I consider myself lucky because I know I can always count on them, and because they love me as much as I love them. However, this doesn't mean that my parents, especially when I was a child, always told me "yes" and made me do whatever I wanted to. On the contrary, I grew up with a lot of "no", and I do not always agree with them in different situations, But they taught me all the important values and good manners, and I'm grateful to them for this, Because nowadays, around me, I see kids who are pleased with everything their parents do: they buy them whatever they want, and treat them like "friends". I believe that this is wrong because, by doing so, they are not doing the right thing. Parents must be parents, and friends must be friends. This doesn't mean that parents should keep themselves distanced from their child; on the contrary, a child should talk to his family, asking for advice or just to confront each other because communication is at the base of the relationships of every kind. I just think that each of us in our life plays a role, and that being a parent is not an easy job, but they should try to do their best. </s></s>

First of all, in 2012, I lived in London for three weeks. I am a teacher at a High School and the authorities in my country let me stay there improving my English. I would like to say that learning any language is complicated for someone no matter where you come from, but in my opinion, there are many points of debate. A good illustration of this would be children. One child whose parents come from different countries is able to learn two languages at the same time. This child doesn't need to go abroad to learn a foreign language, but they are listening to their parents speaking their native language all the time, and this helps them learn without any difficulty. On the other hand, if you go abroad, you will be able to improve your English in an anglophone country, in this case, your knowledge will be reinforced by your stay there. To sum up, if you want to learn English, you don't need to go abroad, you can improve your English by working hard inside your own country, for example, by doing exercises like listening and writing, or you can meet with native people who speak English to practise with them. But if you have the opportunity to go abroad, this would be so good for you and your English. </s></s>

Other forms of transport that could be very useful in the future are the bike, this form of transport is cheap and environmentally friendly, also, more and more cities are building a lot of bike lanes, so it is a good alternative. For travelling between cities or towns, in my opinion, the car will remain the most widely used form of transport, although the new modes of transport could change this situation. In conclusion, I think that the most used form of transport in cities in the future will be the bus, the metro and the bike, and for travelling into cities the car will remain the most widely used. </s></s>

Downstairs, there would be 5 bedrooms with big beds, 2 bathrooms, one of them with a Jacuzzi, a beautiful kitchen with an American fridge (one of those that has 2 big doors) and a table in the center, where I could eat with my family, and a pleasant living room with 2 or 3 large sofas. Upstairs, there would be a games room where I could play with my nephews, nieces and my daughter, another bathroom, an office to work and study English, and finally a huge room called “the cinema room”, with several comfortable seats and a giant screen where my friends and I could see our favourite films. </s></s>

Digital advertising; an exciting but undesirable business It is indisputable that advertising has become a permanent fixture in our daily lives. Once a curious novelty that was largely considered a harmless addition to our sometimes dull and overly familiar environment, it was welcomed as fun and informative. It was also - if one wished to do so - relatively easy to ignore. But we have now entered a new era of the attention-grabbing business: its digitalisation. Their transformation from innocent posters to digital screens ranging in size from miniscule to vast has made adverts all-pervasive. Researchers say that an average adult in the developed world is now exposed to hundreds of commercial messages every day. Those involved in this lucrative business are in awe of the almost endless possibilities that recent technological advances offer them. Multimedia advertising and entertainment companies now work in synergy to target everyone from toddlers who can barely speak to pensioners confused by the speed of life in the new age, unsubtly playing on their needs and desires in order to turn them all into faithful consumers. They have so successfully infiltrated their own product into our everyday existence that we no longer see it anymore as what it really is: a nuisance. Creators of adverts have long given up on informing the consumers and instead opted for seducing them. The result is insincere, misleading and often deceptive messages that our minds are saturated with. Perhaps it is time to conduct an experiment and hit the pause button and reflect upon this subject matter. Imagine a world without adverts for a week at least. Would it be bleak and boring and leave us at a loss as to what to buy, or might it just turn out to be a long longed for respite? </s></s>

Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake because the door couldn't be opened again. He was trapped. Michael was very anxious and he didn't know what to do anymore. The room was really dark and Michael couldn't see anything. Then suddenly Michael felt something under his foot. It was a hammer. Micheal tried to hit the door with the hammer, but it was useless because that door was made of steel. Suddenly Micheal heard footsteps coming towards him. Micheal was really scared and he closed his eyes. He opened his eyes again when the footsteps faded away. Michael felt strange, because he wasn't feeling walls around him. Micheal was stuck in nowhere. Suddenly Micheal felt pain in his chest. The pain got stronger and stronger. He felt like he was about to die. He started crying because there was nothing he could do about it. At the moment Micheal wanted to die, he saw a light coming from beyond. He started running towards the light. The moment he reached the light everything changed. He didn't feel anything. He was able to fly. Micheal seemed really happy at that moment. Micheal felt something shaking him. He was really confused because he thought he was dead. Suddenly Micheal opened his eyes and he realized it was just a weird dream. </s></s>

In terms of holidays, some people like to visit their own countries while others prefer going abroad. I think going abroad is much more exciting. Visiting their own country certainly has its advantages. First of all, you don't have to take very long trips. Also, you have the opportunity to discover new places just next to your home. In addition, this type of vacation is usually less expensive than going abroad. On the other hand, many people prefer visiting other countries. Actually, they like the idea of visiting an unknown land where everything is different from the weather to the customs. In addition, they also like going abroad to visit important and famous cities around the world like Paris, Madrid, New York. In my opinion, traveling to a foreign country broadens people's minds about other cultures. In fact, going abroad is a good way to make new friends, try new things and improve your language skills. In addition, if you plan your vacation very soon, you can also save money on flights or hotels. In conclusion, I think it's important to know both about your own country and foreign lands. </span></span>

This project is historical research into the relationship between the Euro and Denmark to discover and understand the changes made by Danish institutions and the government in order to adapt their social, economic and political system to the new European currency. With this research, I want to discover if those changes helped Denmark protect itself from the European crisis. The Danish measures will also be compared with other actions taken by European Countries like Italy. This study project will be developed by studying Danish and European historical documents and previous research on the Euro; old and contemporary Danish journalistic articles; Danish and European institutions such as the ECB, the European Commission, the Danish Ministry of Finance and Foreign Affairs, and it will be necessary to conduct and analyse interviews with Danish and European politicians, economists and experts on this historic and economic field. The aim is to                                                       the new political, economic and social structure of Denmark in relation to the Euro and all its consequences. </end>

Introduction The aim of this proposal is to present suggestions regarding the ways in which the extra funding could be used to benefit the students and, indirectly, the local community. Needless to say, in order to combat the rising tide of social problems in Hampshire, the Education Authority decided to increase funds for the educational sector. Sports Club Physical activities might improve the overall condition of the students and for this reason they are necessary. It is well known that physical activity contributes to improving physical and mental health. Drama Club This kind of club will allow students to express their feelings in a non-violent manner, learn how to manage their reactions and develop creative talent. A drama club will make examining plays such as Shakespeare's more enjoyable than solely studying them, alone. Cookery classes Cookery classes are very important because the students here are young adults that need basic skills such as cooking in order to manage on their own and live an independent life. Cooking classes will help students spend less money on eating out and they will start eating healthier because by making their own food, they will be more aware of what they are eating. DIY Classes "Do it yourself" classes improve practical skills. As most college students soon leave for university and live in dorms without their parents, they are obligated to solve mechanical problems on their own. The information they acquire during these courses will help them for the rest of their lives. Citizenship classes Another kind of class that is necessary are citizenship classes because today's teenagers are deficient in this area. These courses will develop the civic sense of the students and they will start actively engaging in society. Conclusion The overall purpose of these actions is to keep young adults in school and to educate them. The Education Authority believes that social problems are linked with a decrease in participation in extracurricular activities and suggests that the college should use extra funding to solve this issue. Organising clubs and courses such as the ones mentioned above would improve the situation, 
             .

My favorite sport is badminton, which I have played for seven years and discovered this sport when I was in junior high. At first, I was not interested in it since I had no idea how to play because I had only played basketball and volleyball, but, I didn't enjoy these two at all. In addition, I also didn't like doing exercise that was tiring and my strength was extremely weak that every time I ran 800 kilometers, I always came last. But when I decided to sit aside and talked with my friends, one of my male friends who is still in touch with me at present, asked me to play together. After he found out the reason why I didn't have any desire to play, he told me to give it a try, and if I still didn't like it, he wouldn't force me. Then, he taught me how to play, for example, when hitting the ball, used the strength of the whole arm and did not just use the elbow, or you would feel tired very quickly. While playing, I enjoyed this exercise because I had never sweated so much and felt refreshed before. The funniest thing to me was that I thought I was a child who attended kindergarten the way he taught. When hitting the ball successfully, he would say, ''good, keep going                                                            ''. Hitting the ball over and over again, I learned that I unconsciously loved badminton, which not only includes running but also concentration. Badminton is an easy sport that anyone can try, just focus on the ball and hit it back. In addition, before playing, you must warm up your body and relax your muscles after playing to avoid suffering injuries. </s></s>
Learning many ideas and knowing detailed facts are both considered crucial for students's education. Some people think that knowing facts is more easily and practical. Nevertheless, others consider learning ideas and concepts is the best way to solve many academic and real-life problems. In my view, l completely agree with the idea that it is more important for students to learn ideas and concepts than learn facts, I would like to give my reasons. First, learning facts can help students solve one kind of problem that they may encounter. However, ideas and concepts give people a competitive advantage in dealing with similar issues. For example, once, I did not understand an idea that my teacher explained in class, but just remember facts. When I did my homework, the problem was different than the one discussed in the class, whereas, I went back to my textbook and tried to understand the ideas and concepts. I easily worked out the problem. From this experience, I learned that I not just remember facts, but try my best to understand ideas and concepts, thus, I can solve many kinds of problem easily. Second, learning ideas and concepts greatly supports self-education. Consequently, you can reach high academic levels. It is easy to learn facts from people around you. However, learning ideas and concepts requires more investigation and understanding many of the academic textbooks. Nowadays, there is limited time for any teacher to cover all the points on a certain subject. When students grasp an idea of any topic, it will be easy to understand all issues related to it deeply. For instance, when I was in the senior year of high school, I took a physics class. There was a massive amount of information on a specific issue, but l tried my best to understand its concept that helped me identify unmentioned points. In sum, absorbing ideas and facts is the most effective strategy. Not only do students learn more in their studying, but also they help students better understand many facts in our life than any other ways. </s></s>

The line graph illustrates the amount and type of fast food eaten by teenagers in Australia between 1795 and 2000. As an overall trend, it is clear that consumption of fish and chips decreased over the period while the amount of pizzas and hamburgers eaten increased during the same period. In 1975, the consumption of fish and chips was ten times greater than the consumption of the other two types of fast food. However, the quantity of fish and chips plates eaten per year declined from 100 times per year in 1975 to just over 80 times in 1980. Then, there was a slight increase to about 95 times per year in 1985. After that, this trend kept falling and reached the lowest point in 2000 (just under 40 times that year). In contrast, the consumption of hamburgers and pizzas started at about 10 times for hamburgers and 5 times for pizzas in 1975, and then rose constantly until it reached approximately 100 times and 85 times respectively in 1995. It then levelled off during the next 5 years. </sp></sp>

The academic culture refers to the attitudes, values and practices that are shown by people who work or study at universities. After joining ACU (Australian Catholic University), I found vast differences in teaching method between Nepal and Australia. In Nepal, students study individually, and they do not ask questions of the teacher even if they are confused. In contrast, Australian education is based on teaching students new skills. Students need to actively participate in discussion with their peers. In addition, students are able to ask questions of the lecturer because they are able to express their opinion. At first, I felt stressed while studying in groups and used to be hesitant while sharing my ideas and opinion, but now I am familiar with the academic culture. The academic culture is a challenge for many students in effective learning. Peer learning is a small group of three to five students kept together to discuss the content and carry out educational activities in mutual engagement. (Fisher, as cited in Strake, 2010, p.2), Peer learning is a two-way learning process in which group members feel more at ease discussing the content. It helps to understand the importance of group work by giving and receiving feedback on particular tasks. According to Hamp (2002), the goal of the EAP (English for Academic Purposes) course is to teach students relevant study skills they need throughout their degree. It helps to share ideas, knowledge, among the students and makes them think critically by using formal language while writing, etc. In conclusion, the adoption of the Australian academic culture has developed strategies for my learning. I have become an independent learner and started to ask questions, share my opinion with the tutor. In the future, I will improve learning strategies by actively working in a group. </s></s>

I completely disagree with the statement "there is no future for public transport". I do believe that over time people become more conscious of the idea of cities convenient for everyone. Despite the private car is more convenient for its owner than public transport, it is not used most of the time, and that means wasting city space on parking while it could be used as public space. At the same time, it is not impossible to solve the problem of comfort and efficiency simultaneously. For instance, a network of taxis with affordable prices could combine the comfort of a private car with the workload of public transportation. Nowadays, all the car manufacturers accept the task of designing a robot-driven car in the future that in the future would solve the problem of safety and availability of a taxi 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Roger Okeefe is 83 years old and is being referred to your care for further assistance. He is now recovering from Malignant Melanoma to his left shoulder. Peter looked at his watch and knew that he had to do something immediately. Twenty minutes had passed, but Sarah was still inside the house. He started to bite his nails, 
                      . She said that she would go out in five minutes. What if she was in trouble? What if the owner of the house caught her? Five more minutes went by, and he decided to get into the bungalow. He climbed the tree clumsily and managed to get in through the open window. It was a dark night, so he could barely see. —There is no need for you to climb through the window like a thief—said a soft voice. The shock made Peter gasp. Before him was a tall, dark woman in black. He hadn’t seen her when he went into the room. His eyes were adjusted to the darkness now, so he could recognize her. --Tris. Tris's smile became bigger. --It has been a long time, Peter. May I ask you why you are breaking into my house instead of knocking at the door? How rude of you! There was no anger in her voice, but amusement and something else that Peter could not distinguish. --Where is Sarah? She must be here. Tris's smile faded away. -- You are the only person that came here in the last five hours, Peter. Unless... The silence that followed her words was oppressive. They both knew what would happen if Tris's husband found a stranger in his house. -- I must find her before he does it. Please help me find her. She could be in danger. Tris sighed. -- Sorry my friend, but I’m not gonna face my husband again. This time, you are on your own. </s></s>

Nowadays the type of transport that you use is a subject of much discussion. Public transport includes buses, trains, and the subway, but cars, bicycles, and taxis are not forgotten. When making a choice, very different aspects like the environmental impact, the economic viability, and even the time required are taken into account. Firstly, the car option is the best one for comfort because you are not dependent on a specific time to travel and modern cars have the best technology in terms of equipment and facilities. Then, public transport is not as comfortable as the previous one because, luckily, you can find a place to sit and forget about it if it is in the rush hour. On the other hand, traffic is the biggest problem when talking about transport. The facilities of the cars are replaced by a need for punctuality, and, depending on the city, the delays are a concerning issue when talking about travelling on by bus or train. However, the economic aspect is very important to consider when we talk about convenience, because the cars are the most expensive ones. Not only because of the price of the fuel, but also the costs of insurance, the car, the parking fees, etc. In comparison with a bus ticket that costs four pesos and you are sure that sooner or later it will come, to sum up, neither the car nor public transport is considered the perfect option, but considering the long-term consequences as is now common in some European countries, bicycles are the best solution. Riding a bicycle reduces traffic, costs, the environmental impact, and even the number of car accidents. So, what are you waiting for to buy a bicycle and put on a helmet?</s></s>

There are many areas of study that have not been discovered or researched by humans. Many reasons cause research to be extremely difficult. As a result, there is the debate over whether educational institutes have a responsibility to discourage students from pursuing a field of study in which they are unlikely to succeed. In my opinion, the statement is true for the following reasons. Admittedly, some of the research requires a large investment of resources that educational institutes cannot afford. Such research will indeed fail. Educational institutes should discourage students. However, if there is not a lack of the resources for the field of study, educational institutes should support students working in their area of study. Education’s greatest purpose is to encourage students to attempt learning from failure. Take, for example, Thomas Alva Edison, the inventor of the light bulb. He tried a lot of different materials to make the filament for the light bulb. Once, people thought he would succeed. Even though the research really could not succeed, students can learn some things from the course of the research. In the course of the research, students learn how to develop the process of the research and know which aspect will cause the problem making the research fail. In addition, students on the course of the research maybe create serendipity. Like Alexander Fleming, the inventor of the antibiotic, discovered penicillin accidentally during the research on a germ. "You must do the thing you think you cannot do," said by Eleanor Roosevelt. The invaluable thing is turning the impossible into the possible. Therefore, educational institutes should encourage students to attempt an area of study that is unlikely to succeed. </s></s>
We human beings are highly socially  in the world. Therefore, it is inevitable that we have to learn to be part of  society, Parents, in some cases, are mentors to children. However, considering the complexity of  society, I believe it better to learn at school rather than from parents. First of all, there is no denying that parents may teach their children enormous fundamental living skills upon which their progeny depend, Nevertheless, the skills are not diverse enough for children to deal with specific problems when living in a complex society. For example, one of my classmates from senior high school encountered a communication problem involving the other family. As a consequence, they have not talked to each other since then. Following on from the previous paragraph, there will always be people with different living styles, attitudes, and beliefs at every aspect of one's life. Having not lived and learned the skills in a group, especially in school, we will not be skilled entering  society. The society as a whole is a place where both competition and cooperation 
    
    continuously influence every member. If we only live in our original family, the parents will probably forgive us when we make mistakes. In contrast, living in a society is another story: people might blame, compete, or even hurt others no matter who you are. Learning at school, however, provides a valuable opportunity for children to learn not only from teachers, but also from relationships between peers, and as a result, is the path to becoming independent in the future. In a nutshell, a great deal of knowledge needs to be gained by children in order to live in a society, School, a place with diverse students along with their attitudes towards life, might be better than learning merely from the parents. </s></s>

It is well known that an image is better than a thousand words and that may be the reason for the success of television in a recent survey as the most important invention of the last 100 years. However, this choice was not the wisest as there are other inventions more useful than television with better future applications. I am referring to the Internet. Born in the 1970s as a military project to interconnect the missile facilities and the central headquarters, it soon spread to universities and educational centers. Nobody wants to underestimate the importance of television and its achievements. For more than 50 years, it has been the main form of entertainment displacing others such as radio, theater, cinema, and, sadly, also books. In its first years, television was also an important source of culture (theater plays, classic films, etc.). Unfortunately, in the last few years, television has lost this educational focus. The Internet, on the other hand, has become more and more popular not only for entertainment but also for business and today is almost impossible to find an activity in which the Internet doesn't play a major role. The Internet has also replaced television to watch films and TV shows, especially among young people who prefer to download and watch the videos instead of watching according to the fixed schedule of TV. </s></s>

We planted trees near the side of the highway, on unused land, and outside of the city. Now these trees are grown up. They provide shade, shelter for animals, and clean the air. The trees also stop soil erosion in the rainy season. Our city has a well equipped waste management system. Each house in the city has two varieties of bin to keep recyclable and non-recyclable items separate. In the morning, a waste collection truck comes and takes this waste. These waste materials are processed in an environmentally friendly way. </s></s>

In many countries, it's considered that relatives are close family and the only people an individual can be just the way he is. This point of view is based on, for example, that you share an important bond with your family or that you know everything about some members like your cousins and they know everything about you. Maybe most of us spent our childhood with our cousins and they were our best friends for ages. Siblings are another strong piece of evidence supporting this statement. It is usual to hear that this kind of bond is the strongest within a family because everybody thinks that siblings are the only ones with whom you can truly rely on, even though that is not always true. I should talk in the third person because I do not have any brothers or sisters but close relatives. In my case, this role is played by them. On the other hand, we can find arguments against this statement. For example, the debate about the statement that you cannot choose your family but your friends. Thus, it is ideal for those people who have a bad relationship with their families. They have to look for the support provided by the family in other people with whom they can trust. In conclusion, from my point of view, it is true that it is less likely to feel negative feelings within the family like envy, resentment or hatred. So, if you tell a secret to your sister or your cousin, it is almost certain that they aren't going to spread it. Even if you look for good advice, some members of your family could help you from the heart. But the family does not always guarantee these functions nor does friendship. However, friends can be like family and fulfil all these functions, too. Therefore, I only want to remark that family means more than relatives but the people with whom you feel at home. That is, in any place, suddenly you can run into someone who could become your closest relative. </s></s>

Owning a pet is popular today, even in a big city. Many people today have pets of all kinds. Owning a pet would benefit all members of the family. The phenomenon of homeless people has become a serious problem and many countries cannot solve this problem. The number of these people is increasing not just in  developing countries but all over the world. In my opinion, homeless people are victims because nobody wants to live without a shelter. First of all, being without a home is a horrible problem. One of the major reasons for this problem is war especially in the Arab countries like Syria, Libya and Yemen. Every day on the news we see refugees in a miserable condition. They live in tents that do not protect them from cold weather or dangerous insects. They do not have enough food. In addition, the financial crisis, almost all  companies have a financial problem, so the ideal solution for them is downsizing. After a while, the people who are laid off will not have enough money to live on, and they will become homeless. Furthermore, poverty is a result of family problems. Cases of divorce are increasing and many children run away and prefer to live on the streets instead of in a home full of problems. Contrary to the above, some people believe that homeless people are criminals and they cause danger in our society because they need money and food so they can steal or kill for that reason. To conclude, the world has a complicated issue, so the governments and  charitable organizations must make a quick decision and develop a real solution to solve this problem. The homeless people are human beings and they must enjoy their rights in life. </s></s>
Dear Paul, Last month, as you may know, I was a volunteer at the concert by my favourite band in Katowice. It was a real miracle - it turned out that the band's manager was my old friend Daniel and he asked me for help when he found out I was a big fan of the group. Although the work was truly demanding and lasted for quite a while, I must say I really enjoyed it. At first, I had to be involved in it a month before the event,	I was asked to give some information about the concert to local pubs, restaurants etc., so I was handing out leaflets everywhere. By the time the event was upcoming, I had to take over the band's equipment. I had to move it from place to place along with boys from the group. One thing led to another and we ended up having a beer and laughing in a pub. In the end, the concert came off just perfectly! Lots of people showed up, everybody had fun, and the best thing about the musical experience is that you can make friends with famous people and those whom you admire and see only on TV. If you ever have an opportunity to help with this kind of event, I recommend it to you from the bottom of my heart! Looking forward to hearing from you. Yours sincerely, Patrycja.</s></s>

The map shows changes that have taken place in the town of Eastminster since 1999. During this period, the town has seen extensive growth in residential areas and local amenities, and a modernisation of leisure facilities. Parks in the north-east and south-east have been reduced to make way for larger housing estates, the one in the north dramatically increasing the number of residences in Eastminister. As well as woodland in the north-west being remodelled into an adventure park, a hotel and golf course have replaced a historic house and gardens in the centre of the town. to the south of the river, an industrial area has been constructed next to the existing railway, while residential streets have been converted into more modern apartment blocks. With increasing housing comes a bigger hospital and more shopping facilities, the existing shops being built on the site of the old school, with a new school opening on the north bank of the river.</s></s>

This topic leads me to think about professional skill "Architecture design". This leads to different views on whether the best things to improve people's lives have already happened. I hold the belief that the topic for me is completely wrong even though some improvements are easy to use and solve most of the problems. First, the population continues to grow, the space for living is a serious problem although the skyscraper easily solved the biggest problems caused by the population crisis. On the other hand, the skyscraper creates more problems, such as pollution. For example, I designed a                                in a very densely populated city in Taiwan. The skyscraper provides more space for an excess population; however, the building generates more pollution when the skyscraper is constructed using modern materials, such as steel and concrete. They cause damage to the environment when the raw materials are dug out of the site. The pollution must harm the local people and the environment near the site of the raw materials. This is why I mentioned that the problem still exists and the problem only moves to another region and type. Second, the computer system looks like it solves most of the problems; however, this system is more dangerous in specific situations. The "BUG" must appear from a man-made system because of incomplete coding. That is why our personal information is always leaked by the "hacker". For instance, when we enjoy electronic commercial services and shop for goods on the Internet, the hacker may steal private information at the same time. They will use that information to cheat people out of their money on the phone and you will trust them because of the correct personal information. This is a normal phenomenon in Taiwan; however, the police cannot do anything because of the hacker's anonymity. That is what I said that the best improvements still do not exist even though the computer system already solved some problems. Of course, some people may disagree with my position on this issue. That said, I still feel the reasons I presented were strong ones, such as architecture and the computer system. </s></s>

The diagrams illustrate the process for producing bank notes. At the beginning, bank notes have to be well-designed considering colour matching and artwork including issues of safety. After designing, metal plates have to be prepared with the help of experienced machinists. Then, comes the printing step. Ensuring there is colour on both sides, the image is increased gently using a certain type of ink. Most importantly, before distribution, printed sheets with 50 bank notes per sheet have to be checked to make sure they are of perfect quality or not. They can only be packed and distributed when they are of good quality. In other words, both bad sheets and the ones which are badly printed need to be destroyed in a safe way which prevents them from going on the market. That's how bank notes are produced from paper to the one we can purchase goods with in our daily life. </s></s>
There are many different types of music in the world today. Why do we need music? Is the traditional music of a country more important than the international music that is heard everywhere nowadays? Music is a special world. It has its own rules, tools, and the people who are specialized in it. Over decades, music has been the eternally evolving art that develops day by day. We need music most of the time, or even every single day, to enrich our days with happiness and joy, and also to melt away the sorrows or depression that can affect us and prevent us from doing our best. Music is a science! Yes it is, which has many branches and types,  
        , and the other international types that all people throughout the world share, the traditional or local music of a certain area has its fingerprint on the people of that region, and the instruments used in that local music may vary from one sort to another because the people tend to make it from their own basic culture. For example, in Northern Sudan, people have used the "Tambor" as a traditional spiritual tool for their songs. Internationally, the kinds of music are many, however, most of them use the same instruments. In particular, the piano is a universal tool that is used by many musicians as the primary controller of the rhythm of the orchestra. Last but not least, music is a sort of therapy for those who are suffering, so regardless of its type or nationality, it is a kind of medicine for the soul, and I enjoy it very much. </s></s>

He told himself what animals could be there or if there was air there, but he had no choice, so he accepted the challenge. Sarah told him she would go first. She took a deep breath and started to dive. Michael was afraid. He waited for Sarah to come out. He went to the shore to see if she came from the other side, but he found no footprints. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake. </s></s>

This bar chart depicts the average level of knowledge in reading and writing for female and male in six different regions in 2000. From an overall perspective, it is notable a higher proportion of illiterate women in all the regions compared with men, in some cases by more than half the total number of women in each region. The developed countries, Latin America, and East Asia are the three regions with a low percentage of illiterate people, expressed below 20%, whereas Sub-Saharan Africa, the Arab States, and South Asia have a greater than 30% of people who do not know how to read and write. The developed countries have the lowest figures, being almost at 1%, whereas the South Asian numbers rose extremely, reaching almost 60% in the case of the female gender and surpassing the 30% for the male gender. As we can see, an unequal percentage is shown depending on the area where the people come from. </s></s>
